advisories.name: RLSA-2021:1242
advisories.synopsis: Important: mariadb:10.3 and mariadb-devel:10.3 security update
advisories.topic:
An update for the mariadb:10.3 and mariadb-devel:10.3 modules is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisories.description:
MariaDB is a multi-user, multi-threaded SQL database server that is binary compatible with MySQL. 
The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: mariadb (10.3.28), galera (25.3.32).
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

advisories.name: RLBA-2021:1083
advisories.topic: An update for the idm:DL1 module is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
advisories.description: Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments.

advisories.name: RLSA-2021:1064
advisories.synopsis: Moderate: virt:rhel and virt-devel:rhel security update
advisories.topic:
An update for the virt:rhel and virt-devel:rhel modules is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisories.description:
Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) offers a full virtualization solution for Linux on numerous hardware platforms. The virt:rhel module contains packages which provide user-space components used to run virtual machines using KVM. The packages also provide APIs for managing and interacting with the virtualized systems.
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
